intro: Solanum pharmacum, commonly known as the African nightshade, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Solanum pharmacum belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other economically important plants like tomatoes and potatoes. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
